p: Continuous viral random mutations are possible through intermediate host transmission, until a deadly virus develops, as illustrated in Figure 2. Recent evidence revealed that recombination within intermediate hosts has contributed to development of SARS-COV-2 ( 1, 24). Asian outdoor markets could constitute the ideal places for continuous viral mutation exchanges ( 25). As presented in Table 3, the best way to circumvent continuous virus production is targeted surveillance; to at least stop the overspreading by SSEs ( 2, 3, 22, 26). This has also been proposed by Menachery et al. ( 23).
